overview_of_class: Third quarter of intermediate-level Swahili language for scholarly research and multimedia presentation, concluding the review of basic Swahili grammar and survey of forms not covered in first-year, including additional verb extensions and compound structures, and maintenance or development of oral interactive proficiency at Intermediate-Mid/High. There is a required minimum of 150 minutes per week of group class and instructor contact in a MultiMedia Learning Center (MMLC) lab. Besides the official MWF 11:00 period, an additional TTh 3:30-4:50 instructor-contact "extended office hours" track is available in the Deering Library's MMLC Activity Space in room 208. All coursework is accessed and assignments submitted via a dedicated Canvas course site.
name: Swahili II
subject: SWAHILI
